Still, i think there should be some limits to chars that really shouldn't
use it, and increase the less fortuante characters stats, i just see it
boring sometimes to have max all stats on a mage, or cleric, or elf, that
could kill almost anything. there should be caps that increase per lv, just
to make things interesting

I like the new fire elemental and slime recommendations, but don't make them
too powerful

I got a good special attack for the mage, Invisibility, the mage can cast
it, then dissapear, until the mage attacks something, while all undead
creatures can have the special skill, see invis, where they can see.

Rather than limit abilites of some characters, I would expand the
abilites of the not-so-gifted ones.

One of my personal pet peeves is the inability to use up magic energy
at times.  My mega-archmage has summoned elves that could stay in a
forest and launch their most powerfull attacks without running out of
magical energy.  Admittedly, that is advantageous, but trick shouldn't
be.  The fire elementals summoned by my mega-archmage will never be
able to run out of magical energy.  I forgot how high experience level
you have to give a Golem for him not to run out of magical energy.  I
would propose making the amount energy available for an attack related
to the total max magical energy use available.  Effectively, this
would make attacks stronger.

This brings me to another point:  if a summoned image/firre elemental
should exceed max limits for magical energy and/or health, the value
displayed should be the max limit.

I do have a proposed new attack for a fire elemental: suicide.  The
fire elemental could convert all of its health and magical energy into
one super-powerfull starburst or all at a single direction, with
flames continiung until all the energy is absorbed.  Suicide would
only be available at experience level 4 or higher.  Use of this attack
would have to be approved by the player for non-summoned fire
elementals [Suicide would NOT drain health from an archmage if a
summoned fire elemental decided to].  The fire elemental could request
permission only once a minute.
